intro: Eria oreodoxa, commonly known as the white orchid, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its elegant, white petals and a subtle fragrance. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in tropical rainforests. Its flowers are small but numerous, forming dense clusters that bloom during the rainy season. Eria oreodoxa is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological role in supporting biodiversity in its native habitat.
